results.title: Tommy
results.brief_description: Using interviews with and about Tommy Woodcock, this program tells the story of one of Australia’s most renowned racehorse trainers. In particular it concentrates on his work with Phar Lap and Reckless.

results.title: Dominators: Smith, Hayes, Cummings (S)
results.brief_description: Bart Cummings, Colin Hayes and Tommy Smith, Australia’s legendary trio of racehorse trainers. Their notoriety extends beyond the profession they have dominated for decades. Each of them possess a natural affinity with the horse: individually gifted with that enigmatic sixth sense. Record breaking achievements distinguish them from their contemporaries by the length of the Flemington straight. Their amazing winning formula applies not to hundreds of races, but thousands. Between them they’ve won 73 Derbies, 50 Oaks, 11 Cox Plates, 13 Melbourne Cups and 11 Golden Slippers. This is their success story.

results.title: The Big wet
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Hogarth, ABC-TV (Australia) and Discovery Productions
results.brief_description: The monsoon season is the most dramatic of all seasons in Australia, but each year it is different. “The Big wet” is the chronicle of a particularly wet monsoon in the tropical north. It starts with the last days of the dry in September and concludes with the first fires in April. The film looks at the effect it has on all living things in the Top End, particularly the salt-water crocodile, the wallabies and the magpie goose. Featured throughout the program is the majestic scenery of Kakadu and Arnhem Land. Narrated by John Waters.

results.title: Tchaikovsky: Public triumph... personal despair
results.creator_credit: Graham Holloway, Bob Carruthers, Beckmann and Cromwell Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music maestro”.
Adoring audiences, international acclaim and an independent fortune should have made Tchaikovsky a happy man. Unfortunatley they seemed only to add to the secret anguish of a tortured soul hiding dark secrets from the stifling high society of 19th Century Russia. Innovative and informative, this program explores the character of the man and builds a picture of his life and times. Using feature films inserts, stunning period images and a masterful narrative by conductor/composer David Palmer, combined with superb performances by internationally renowned artists, this is an unforgettable record of the life of one of the world’s great composers. Featuring performances of such classics as: 1812 Overture, excerpts from Swan Lake, The Nutcracker Suite, the Slavonic March and more.

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Craig Lahiff, Wayne Groom, FGH Film Consortium, Genesis Films and International Film Management
results.brief_description: Two hundred years ago bands of whalers roamed the oceans. In the Great Southern Land of Australia they discovered natives who cherished a mystical power called the Dreaming - a knowledge handed down from the beginning of their world. The whalers were bloodthirsty men, responsible for rapes killings and massacres - a taint upon the Dreaming. This taint lives on into the present and a new nightmare when a burial ground is unearthed, a girl dies, an ancient curse is revived and a young doctor becomes inextricably involved in a chain of supernatural events that point towards death. Starring Arthur Dignam, Penny Cook, Gary Sweet, Laurence Clifford and Kristina Nehm. Based on a story by Craig Lahiff and Terry Jennings.

results.title: The Fisher king
results.creator_credit: Terry Gilliam, Debra Hill, Lynda Obst and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: When a bigshot self-absorbed talkback radio host, Jack Lucas (Jeff Bridges), loses his job after a tragedy, he is plucked from disaster by the most improbable of saviours - a former history professor (Robin Williams), driven mad and onto the streets where he lives in a remarkable medieval world full of swords and sorcery, terrifying Red Knights and damsels in distress. This film serves grand lunacy and wisdom of the highest order with rare vision and style.

results.title: How green was my valley
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Winner of five Academy Awards, this is an inspiring yet heart-breaking film from producer Darryl Zanuck and director John Ford. Sixty year old Huw Morgan looks back on his life as a boy (Roddy McDowall) in a small Welsh mining town. His reminiscences reveal the disintegration of the closely knit Morgans, and his devoted parents (Donald Crisp, Sara Allgood), while capturing the sentiments and issues of their time. Maureen O’Hara and Walter Pidgeon co-star in this acclaimed classic, the story of one family’s dreams, struggles and triumphs. Based on the famous novel by Richard Llewellyn. Includes performances by the Welsh Singers.

results.title: A Day in the life of a child: introducing environmental action
results.creator_credit: Stephen Weingarth, Tim Cramer and Educational and Documentary Video Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed in Australia, this program combines acting, animation and real life environmental situations in homes, schools and communities. Demonstrates how young people can think and act in an environmentally friendly manner and have fun as well.

results.title: Classic cars in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jeff Watson and Jeff Watson Productions
results.brief_description: Featured in “My Car” on “The World Tonight” with Clive Robertson. In an age when all cars look the same, this video profiles the cars we would all like to own, or did own. Some of the cars features are the Austin Healy “Bug-Eye” Sprite, Austin 7, Ford Mustang, Jaguar SS, Mercedes-Benz 300SL “Gullwing”, Morris Minor, Volkswagen 1946, plus classic cars from the Repco Mountain Rally.

results.title: Nature's landscapes
results.creator_credit: Klaus Toft and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: This is a stunning visual journey through Australia’s natural environment, accompanied by evocative and beautiful classical music with natural sound effects. Soar across harsh and unforgiving deserts, plunge into turbulent seas and delve into ancient, lush forests… be swept along with the sights and sounds of this majestic and beautiful land. Featuring the music of Tchaikovsky, Vivaldi, Mozart and other classical masters, this is an imaginative marriage of breathtaking images and sound.
